It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1829 Oct. 21
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from Thursday October 21, 1829, on which date three cases involving a stolen horse, debt, and a murder were heard before the Court. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Wensday 21st October
div1.p:
Horace Brown
vs
Nancy & Sally Miller
The court aquit the defts. 21st Octr.
The court find for the defendend

The court concur with the decition of the sentence having been passed in the circuit court, this court decide that they have no power to take it up of susspending the sentence of Said Circuit court. 19th October.
Court adjourned to Thursday morning at 10 Oclock
